intro: Hieracium eurylepium, commonly known as the showy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and woodland edges, preferring well-drained soils. It produces yellow flowers with a central disk surrounded by ray florets, and its leaves are usually lance-shaped with hairy surfaces. Hieracium eurylepium is often found in temperate climates and can thrive in a variety of light conditions.
